intro: Haplophyllum alberti-regelii f. subternata, commonly known as the subternate haplophyllum, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive subternate inflorescence, where flowers are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, aiding in water conservation. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
